Class AudioManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.utils.AudioManager
public final class AudioManager extends Object
Singleton class managing all audio playback for the Tetris game. Provides methods to play various sound effects including: rotation sounds, brick placement, hover effects, click sounds, game over audio, and special effects.

This class uses lazy loading to initialize media players and provides volume control for all sound effects.

See Also:
  • SafeMediaPlayer

  • Method Details

    • setSfxVolume

      public void setSfxVolume(double vol)
      Sets the global sound effects volume. Applies to all currently loaded SFX players.
      Parameters:
      vol - the volume level (0.0 to 1.0)

    • getSfxVolume

      public double getSfxVolume()
      Gets the current sound effects volume.
      Returns:
      the current volume level (0.0 to 1.0)

    • getInstance

      public static AudioManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of AudioManager.
      Returns:
      the AudioManager instance

    • setSuppressSfx

      public void setSuppressSfx(boolean suppress)
      Enables or disables sound effect suppression. When suppressed, all SFX calls are ignored.
      Parameters:
      suppress - true to suppress SFX, false to allow

    • playRotation

      public void playRotation()
      Plays the rotation sound effect.

    • playBricksTouch

      public void playBricksTouch()
      Plays the brick touch/landing sound effect.

    • playHover

      Plays the button hover sound effect.

    • getFlickeringDurationSeconds

      public double getFlickeringDurationSeconds()
      Returns the total duration of the flickering sound in seconds.
      Returns:
      the duration in seconds, or 0 if unavailable

    • stopFlickering

      public void stopFlickering()
      Stops the flickering sound effect if playing.

      public void stopAll()
